intro: Anoplocaryum myostideum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Anoplocaryum myostideum is often found in moist, disturbed habitats and can become invasive in some regions.
